channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024031040
item.description:
Report X-2024031040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operation at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box were glass bottles packaged in bags with styrofoam moldings top and bottom. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024031038
item.description:
Report X-2024031038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 03/22/2024 at approximatley 0032, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 281407 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 12 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4, 4-Liter cans of paint. In the offending package, one of the cans appeared to leak due to a loose security ring, resulting in spillage. The 11 unharried packages continued in transport to destination and the offending package was held, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • City: MURFREESBORO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to our attention after it was found crushed and with a leakage. It was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage and was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: Two of the bottles were crushed inward which resulted in loosened caps and a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Low Temp San lost 0.4lb of fluid from loose cap closure. No safety seals below caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024030969
item.description:
Report X-2024030969

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: Upon Inspection content had a loose cap resulting in the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030755
item.description:
Report X-2024030755

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found on Unload Side at 12:50am inside a ELOU trailer FEDZ553423. Upon Inspection box was leaking Nu-Brite from a loose cap causing internal leakage. DescribePack: The cap on one of the containers was loose causing liquid to come out. Found in the beginning (next to the trailer door) of the trailer with a lot of space to move around. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was on scene as package was being unloaded and took immediate action to mitigate release.

item.title: Report X-2024030926
item.description:
Report X-2024030926

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was first brought to our attention as it needed further processing. As it was inspected, it was found that the lid of the drum was propped up enough to cause a spillage. The drum was then placed into a plastic bag and into a hazardous tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The lid of the drum was propped up enough to cause a spillage. There was a minor leakage and the outside of the drum as covered in residue. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed into a plastic bag and then into a hazardous tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030884
item.description:
Report X-2024030884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat Spill. Undeclared hazmat: no hazmat markings or paperwork present on outer packaging (Spidr checked). No overpack label. Leaking fiberboard box found in sealed (with zip-tie) bag within tote on HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unknown; the OP-951 was not filled out at the instance of discovery on the dock. DescribePack: Content: One 5 gallon metal drum with a removable head (1A2) lost 15oz of fluid from deterioration of the o-ring or seal fitted around the fill hole and inlaid cap/plug in the lid of the drum. Although the cap/plug inlaid in the drum lid was intact, tipping drum to the side allowed leakage from just under the cap/plug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024030716
item.description:
Report X-2024030716

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found covered in green paint and with a leakage. It was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage and transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the cans inside had a puncture like damage at the bottom that could have been caused from over-pressurizing. The rest of the cans were soiled in the paint as well as a small box with the Ltd Qty symbol that was inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030792
item.description:
Report X-2024030792

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver dropped it off at VSA where it was found and put in a QA tote and placed in the hazmat cage for later inspection. DescribePack: Damage hazmat was brought back to VSA this morning, where it was found leaking. Upon inspection, a loose cap or minor punctures seem to be the cause of the leakage and damage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in bag and then in a tote in the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found covered in a blue substance and a minor leakage. Package was placed into a tote and brought to the HazMat after discovering that the products inside were aerosols and contained inner packages with the Ltd Qty symbol. DescribePack: One of the cans had a puncture at the top of the can which resulted in a leakage. The rest of the cans we soiled in the blue paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030883
item.description:
Report X-2024030883

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking carton was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA. No other information is available. DescribePack: The inner container, a plastic pail/drum, was cracked down the side and across the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote. The spillage was confined to the tote and overpack box. Gloves and a mask were worn while handling and processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030717
item.description:
Report X-2024030717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found covered in blue paint and a leakage. It was placed into a plastic tote mitigate any additional spillage and transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the cans had a puncture like damage at the bottom of the can which was likely caused from being over pressurized and resulted in a leakage. The rest of the cans were soiled in the paint. There were two smaller boxes in the package that had the Ltd Qty symbol. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

DescribePack: The two bottles in the shipment leaked at the caps. One bottle was leaning sideways due to insufficient filler. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote. Leakage was confined to the carton. PPE was worn while inspecting and processing.

  • Description: DURING UNLOADING OPERATIONS, UNIT UNLOADING PUMP CAUSE OVER PRESSURISING SYSTEM RESULTING IN MATERIAL RELEASE FROM PUMP HOUSING IN UNLOADING LINES. UNLOADING OPERATIONS WERE HAULTED. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONELL.
